p:
Genomic association studies have revealed about 45 loci containing variants related to an increased or decreased probability of developing AD
29, 30 . However, the functional variants and their target genes remain mostly elusive
31 . To contribute to the identification of target genes, we first evaluate the expression of 176 genes located within the 45 loci associated with the AD risk (Supplementary Table 10)
31 and 3 causal AD genes—PSEN1, PSEN2, and APP—in individual cell types of the adult human brain. We found that 116 out of the 179 AD risk/causal genes were expressed by at least one of the major cell types identified in the brain (Fig. 8A and Supplementary Table 11). Subsets of these genes were exclusively expressed either in microglial cells (14 out of 116), neurons (12), astrocytes (2), oligodendrocytes (6), or endothelial cells (6), suggesting cell-type specific roles for these AD risk/causal genes.
